example.name: input-range-extended
example.synopsis: Using a datalist to enhance your sliders
example.description: When you attach a datalist to your range input, you give the users a pre-defined list.
example.example:
<wsform action="get">
<wsfield type="range" list="tickmarks" />

<datalist id="tickmarks">
  <option value="0" label="0%">
  <option value="10">
  <option value="20">
  <option value="30">
  <option value="40">
  <option value="50" label="50%">
  <option value="60">
  <option value="70">
  <option value="80">
  <option value="90">
  <option value="100" label="100%">
</datalist>
</wsform>
example.note: Currently, no browser fully supports these features. Firefox doesn't support hash marks and labels at all, for example, while Chrome supports the hash marks but doesn't support labels.
